exercises.title: PROTEUS exercises
exercises.p: As noted in the introduction to , we are interested in learning more about how the the second derivative of a function and the behavior of the graph of the function are related.

statement.p: In the Desmos window below, you will find a graph of a function that you can experiment with by clicking on the point P on the graph, and moving it along the graph of f. You will also see a green point representing the value of the second derivative of graph of f corresponding to the point P. As you move the point P, note that the tangent line to the graph moves along with the point. Then, do the following:

Carefully observe the shape of the graph and where it opens up versus down.
Investigate the relationship of the tangent line to the graph as you move the point. For example, at what points is the tangent line above or below the graph?
Notice the sign of the second derivative at various points, by observing the green dot corresponding to P.
In the Desmos command line, toggle on the graph of the derivative function and repeat the steps above, paying attention to where the derivative is increasing and decreasing.
It will be useful to make a list of your observations as you experiment.

match.premise: the tangent line lies below the graph near the point P
the graph opens up (is shaped like a bowl that could hold water)
f'(x) switches between increasing and decreasing
the tangent line lies both above and below the graph near the point P
the graph switches from opening up to opening down
the tangent line lies above the graph near the point P
the graph opens down (is shaped like an upside down bowl)

statement.p: Finally, write a summary of your findings that will help you to understand how the sign of the second derivative relates to the shape of the graph.
